column1: You're at the right place for resume help.
I'm your advanced resume coach.
On this page you'll add your resume and a job description.
You can add saved resumes.
You can type or paste your resume text.
You can find a job description from any source and paste its text in the second box.
Also you can find a job description you like in the job search above and click add.
Once your resume and job description are added click the analyze button.
Your resume and job description are analyzed by our highly trained OpenAI assistant.
Your resume analysis will include a fitness score.
You'll get a list of resume job description and missing keywords.
Revise your resume based on the missing keywords list.
You'll see your initial job fit score.
This shows how well your resume will pass applicant tracking systems.
Maximize this score to enable your resume to pass through ats systems.
Add details to the missing keywords box showing how you achieved each item.
Delete any for which you have no information.
You'll also receive alternative role suggestions.
Submit your details and our OpenAI assistant will revise your resume.
You will also receive a well-written cover letter.
Your resume will also get a final job fit score.
To be competitive you should aim for ninety percent or higher before submission.
Save and rework your high-scoring resumes.
Download your resume and cover letter and save them for rework later.
Read your new resume and cover letter carefully when you decide to use them.
AIs are limited like people.
Details may be incorrect so always review what advanced resume supplies.
Hello!
I'll be your interviewer.
Please take a breath relax and I'll ask you some easy questions.
Since this is a practice interview I'll give you with a score for each answer.
Use this score to answer that question better in future interviews.
Make sure your microphone is connected.
Speech recognition will capture your words so you don't have to type them.
Your words will appear in the answer box and you can edit them before sending them.
Avoid giving personal information you don't want to reveal.
Enable your microphone or you can type your response.
You will have about 30 seconds (120 words) of space for your answer.
Ready?
Here we go!
First question.
Second question.
Third question.
Fourth question.
Fifth question.
Let's discuss a general question.
Can you tell me a little about yourself?
How did you hear about this position?
What do you know about our company?
Why do you want to work here?
Why are you leaving your current job?
What are you looking for in a new position?
What can you offer us that someone else can't?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What's your dream job?
What are your professional goals?
Let's talk about your experience and background?
Can you describe your experience at your current or previous role?
How would you describe your work style?
How has your current role evolved since you started?
What challenges have you faced and how did you overcome them?
Can you explain the gap in your employment history?
What accomplishments are you most proud of?
How do you handle stress and pressure?
Describe a time you disagreed with a decision from your manager?
How do you prioritize your tasks?
Describe a mistake you made and how you handled it?
Let's discuss your skills and qualifications.
How do you handle failure?
How do you evaluate success?
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
What technical skills do you possess that would benefit our team?
Can you describe a time when you led a team?
How do you handle feedback?
Describe a situation where you had to collaborate with a difficult colleague?
How do you educate yourself on our industry and its challenges?
Let's discuss job-specific questions.
How would you handle working with a difficult colleague?
What do you think are the biggest challenges in this role?
How do you approach difficult job tasks?
What experience do you have with software tools and techniques for this role?
How would you deal with an unhappy customer or client?
How do you stay updated with the latest industry trends?
Describe a project you led from start to finish.
How familiar are you with industry regulations or standards?
Have you ever had to introduce a new idea or procedure to a team?
Describe a time when you had to make a tough decision without all the information you needed.
Let's talk about cultural fit and motivation.
How would your colleagues describe you?
How do you handle work-life balance?
What are you passionate about?
What motivates you?
Describe the best work culture you've been part of.
How do you handle criticism?
What values are most important to you in a job?
How do you handle new challenges or unfamiliar tasks?
Do you prefer to work in a team or alone?
How do you handle tight deadlines?
What would you do if you found out a team member was providing incorrect information?
This concludes your practice interview.
Your score is being calculated.
